title: Best Jalape√±o Popper Dip Recipe - How to Make Jalape√±o Popper Dip
description: It's so much easier to serve to a crowd.
body: <style type="text/css">#sidepanel{transform:translateX(0);visibility:visible;content-visibility:auto;}@media (max-width:425px){#sidepanel{width:7rem;max-width:7rem;}#sidepanel .nav-item,#sidepanel .nav-item a,#sidepanel footer a,#sidepanel div a,#sidepanel a span{font-size:10px;}#sidepanel ul,#sidepanel div{padding:0;margin:0;}#sidepanel button{display:none;}}</style>SearchMy RecipesSubscribeMembership BenefitsRecipesMealsHolidaysFood TrendsNewsKitchen Tips & ToolsAll VideosAbout UsNewsletterDelish ShopFollowOther EditionsYour Privacy ChoicesPrivacy NoticeTerms Of UseSkip to ContentRecipesDinnersSpring RecipesKitchen TipsNewsSubscribesign inSearchMeals & CookingRecipe HeadquartersJalape√±o Popper DipJalape√±o Popper DipBy Lindsay FunstonUpdated: Jan 9, 2025Approved by the Delish Test Kitchen4.611 RatingsPHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: LESLIE RANEYYields: 4 - 6 serving(s)Prep Time:      10 minsTotal Time:      30 minsCal/Serv: 990Jump to recipeSavePrintJalape√±o poppers will always be a staple party app in my book, but let‚Äôs be honest‚Äîit‚Äôs the cheesy, creamy filling (plus the bacon, of course) that everyone‚Äôs really after. I decided to cut to the chase in this recipe by incorporating all of the best parts of the classic appetizer into a super cheesy, smoky party dip that‚Äôs so much easier to serve to a crowd. The creamy, cheesy dip and crispy bacon balances out the kick from the jalape√±o‚Äîeven the heat-averse will keep coming back for more. Ready in 30 minutes, it‚Äôs the perfect last-minute addition to complete your Super Bowl party. Here‚Äôs everything you need to know:What People Are Saying:‚ÄúEven my kiddos ate this up!! So yummy! We just made it to have something different. So glad I found this recipe. Simple and oh so good.‚Äù - GoldTurtle‚ÄúI made this for a tailgating party and everyone loved it. This will definitely be added into the hot dip rotation!‚Äù- RedBoxHow To Make Jalape√±o Popper DipINGREDIENTSPHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: LESLIE RANEYBacon: Crispy bacon not only is added to our dip filling, but is sprinkled on top for a smoky, crispy bite. If you‚Äôre vegetarian, you can leave it out, but it will take out a layer of flavor from the dip.Cream Cheese: Like many of our hot dips, cream cheese creates the base in this recipe. It‚Äôs thick and tangy, and makes for a perfect rich base.Mayo & Sour Cream: These two not only add even more tang to our dip, but they also help balance out the cream cheese. If you‚Äôre not a mayo fan, don‚Äôt worry‚Äîit blends well in the dip, and you won‚Äôt taste it distinctly.Garlic Powder: A little bit of garlic powder adds another savory note to our dip, and blends better than adding raw minced garlic.Jalape√±os: If you can‚Äôt take the heat, feel free to remove the seeds. Alternatively, you can try pickled jalape√±os or pickled peppers instead.Cheese: Cheddar and Monterey Jack are my go-to cheeses for this dip. They melt well, and balance well together. Feel free to switch it up if you have another melty cheese you‚Äôd prefer to use.STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONSYou can make this dip in the Instant Pot or in the oven; I‚Äôm going to detail how to bake it in the oven here. If you want to make it in the Instant Pot, follow the steps down below! First, we‚Äôll prep our bacon. In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon in batches until crispy. Then, remove with a slotted spoon and drain on a paper towel-lined plate. Once cool enough to touch, chop into pieces. PHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: LESLIE RANEYBefore making our dip, make sure that your cream cheese is softened! Then, grab a large bowl, and mix together the cream cheese, mayo, sour cream, garlic powder, and most of the bacon and jalape√±os (but not all), along with the majority of both of the cheeses. We‚Äôre reserving part of the bacon, jalape√±os, and cheese for the top as well. Once mixed together, season with salt and pepper. PHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: LESLIE RANEYOnce combined and seasoned, transfer to a small oven-proof skillet or baking dish. Make sure the dish is evenly filled, then add the rest of the cheese and the reserved bacon and jalape√±os. PHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: LESLIE RANEYPHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: LESLIE RANEYAdd to your preheated 350¬∫ oven, and bake until the dip is golden and bubbly throughout. This should take around 15 to 20 minutes. If you‚Äôre looking for an extra golden top, then you can broil for an extra 3 minutes. PHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: LESLIE RANEYOnce baked to your liking, serve alongside tortilla chips, veggies, and anything else you please. PHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: LESLIE RANEYThe full list of ingredients and instructions can be found in the recipe below. Jalape√±o Popper Dip VariationsAdd a crispy topping. For an easy upgrade, sprinkle with a crispy panko topping: Simply stir together 1/2 cup panko bread crumbs, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and a pinch of salt and sprinkle on top of the dip before baking.Switch up the bacon. Swap out the bacon with your favorite fatty pork like chorizo, diced crispy pork belly, or crispy pancetta if you prefer. You can leave it out completely for a vegetarian app, but it will lose some of its signature smoky flavor. Serving IdeasI love to serve this dip with tortilla chips or toasted baguette slices, but you could also pair it with cut veggies, your favorite crackers, or even homemade pretzels.Make AheadIf you‚Äôd like to get a head start on this dish the day before, prepare this dish as directed, then wrap tightly and store in the fridge. When ready to serve, simply bake! Keep in mind that you may have to add a few minutes to your cook time if refrigerated.StorageIf you have any dip leftovers, wrap tightly and store in the fridge for 3-4 days.PHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: LESLIE RANEYRead MoreAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowIngredientsSee All Nutritional InformationPrint10 slices bacon1 (8-oz.) block cream cheese, softened1/3 cup mayonnaise1/3 cup sour cream1 tsp. garlic powder2 ¬†jalape√±os,¬†seeds removed if desired, finely chopped, divided1 1/2 cups shredded cheddar1 1/2 cups shredded Monterey JackKosher saltFreshly ground black pepperDirectionsFor the ovenStep¬†1Preheat oven to 350¬∫. In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, cook bacon in batches until crispy, about 8 minutes. Drain on a paper towel‚Äìlined plate, then chop.Step¬†2In a large bowl, mix cream cheese, mayo, sour cream, garlic powder, most of the cooked bacon (reserve some for topping), most of the jalape√±os (reserve some for topping), and 1 c. cheddar and 1 c. Monterey Jack; season with salt and pepper.Step¬†3Transfer to a small ovenproof skillet or baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup c. cheddar and ¬Ω c. Monterey Jack and reserved bacon and jalape√±os.Step¬†4Bake dip until golden and bubbly, 15 to 20 minutes. (If desired, broil 3 minutes to get cheese extra-golden.)For the Instant PotStep¬†1Transfer mixture into a 1-qt. baking dish that will fit in your Instant Pot. Cover dish with foil.Step¬†2Place the trivet in bottom of pot and pour in 1 c. water. Fold a large piece of foil (about 18") into thirds to make a long ‚Äúsling‚Äù and lower into pot. Place baking dish on trivet, centered on the foil strip. Fold strips over top, but not touching the top. Lock lid and set to Pressure Cook on high for 15 minutes.¬†Step¬†3Follow manufacturer‚Äôs guide for quick release, making sure to wait until cycle is complete before unlocking and removing lid. Using foil strips and pot holders, carefully remove baking dish.¬†Step¬†4Turn on broiler. Sprinkle top of dip with remaining ¬Ω c. cheddar and ¬Ω c. Monterey Jack. Broil, watching closely, until cheese is bubbly and golden, about 3 minutes.Step¬†5Top with reserved bacon and jalape√±os.PHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: LESLIE RANEYMore Warm Dip RecipesBacon Spinach DipPHOTO: ERIK BERNSTEIN; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREChicken Enchilada DipPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREBuffalo Chicken DipPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONMade This?Let us know how it went in the comments below!Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowAppetizersLemon-Blueberry Brie Bites69 Springy Easter Appetizers20  Recipes For Your First Dinner Party47 Kid-Friendly Easter RecipesAdvertisement - Continue Reading Below56 Party-Perfect Spring Appetizers24 OTT Deviled Egg IdeasSour Cream & Onion Deviled EggsDirty Martini Deviled EggsMexican Street Corn Deviled EggsRoasted Shallot & Garlic Caesar Dip21 Last-Minute Appetizers30 Best Spring DipsAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowNewsletterSubscribeManage SubscriptionAbout UsDelish Test KitchenMedia KitCommunity GuidelinesAdvertise With UsDelish Shop Product SupportOther Hearst SubscriptionsDelish Unlimited Membership SupportTurn off Web NotificationsA Part of Hearst Digital MediaWe may earn commission from links on this page, but we only recommend products we back.¬©2025 Hearst Magazine Media, Inc.
